Welcome to Fastapi_HW’s documentation!¶

REST API repository Auth¶

auth.login_for_access_token(db: Session = Depends(get_db), form_data: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType))¶

The login_for_access_token function is a ReST endpoint that accepts POST requests with the following JSON body: {

&quot;username&quot;: string, &quot;password&quot;: string,

}

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • form_data – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

Returns:

A json response with the access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async auth.register_user(user: UserCreate, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The register_user function creates a new user in the database. It takes a UserCreate object as input, which is validated by Pydantic. If the email address already exists in the database, it raises an HTTPException with status code 409 (Conflict). Otherwise, it creates a new user and returns that user’s information.

Parameters:

  • user – schemas.UserCreate: Pass in the user data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A user object, which is defined in the schemas

Doc-author:

Trelent

auth.verify_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The verify_email function is used to verify a user’s email address. It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and decodes it using JWT. If the token is valid, then we set the user’s account as active.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

  • db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

A message saying that the email has been verified successfully

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Crud¶

crud.authenticate_user(db: Session, email: str, password: str)¶

The authenticate_user function takes in a database session, an email address and a password. It then checks to see if the user exists in the database by calling get_user with the email address. If no user is found, it returns False. If a user is found, it verifies that their password matches what’s stored in the database using verify_password from passlib.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

  • email – str: Pass the email address of the user to be authenticated

  • password – str: Pass in the password that the user enters when they try to log in

Returns:

A user object if the password is correct

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a JWT token with the given payload. The expiry time is set to 30 minutes by default, but can be overridden by passing an expires_delta parameter.

Parameters:

  • data – dict: Store the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[timedelta]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

The encoded jwt

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.create_contact(db: Session, contact: ContactCreate, user_id: int)¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.
Args:

db (Session): The database session to use for creating the contact. contact (ContactCreate): The data of the new contact to create.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • contact – ContactCreate: Create a contact object

  • user_id – int: Identify the user that is creating the contact

Returns:

The newly created contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.create_user(db: Session, user: UserCreate)¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

db (Session): The database session to use for this operation. user (UserCreate): The UserCreate object to create in the database.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – UserCreate: Create a new user in the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.delete_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int)¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

db (Session): The database session to use for querying. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to delete.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.get_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int)¶

The get_contact function takes in a database session and contact_id, and returns the first contact found with that id.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.get_contacts(db: Session, user_id: int, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user with the given id. The skip and limit parameters are used to paginate through results.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user_id – int: Filter the contacts by owner_id

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts that are returned

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.get_current_active_user(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_current_active_user function is a dependency that returns the current user, if they are active. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 400 and detail &quot;Inactive user&quot;.

Parameters:

current_user – schemas.User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The current user, but only if the user is active

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.get_current_user(db: Session = Depends(get_db), token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It uses the OAuth2 authorization scheme to validate a user’s credentials and return their information from our database.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get access to the database

  • token – str: Pass the token that is sent in the authorization header

Returns:

The user that is currently logged in

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: Session, user_id: int)¶

The get_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next week.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user_id – int: Filter the contacts by owner_id

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthdays are in the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.get_user(db: Session, email: str)¶

The get_user function takes in a database session and an email address. It then queries the database for a user with that email address, and returns it.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • email – str: Specify the type of the parameter

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.search_contacts(db: Session, query: str, user_id: int)¶

The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match a given query. The function takes in a database session, the search query, and an owner_id to filter by. It returns all contacts that match the search criteria.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • query – str: Filter the contacts by a search query

  • user_id – int: Filter the contacts by owner_id

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

crud.update_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

db (Session): The database session object. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. contact (ContactUpdate): A ContactUpdate object containing updated information for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to update

  • contact – ContactUpdate: Pass in the updated contact information

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Main¶

main.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact – schemas.ContactCreate: Pass the contact data to the create_contact function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – schemas.User: Get the current user’s id

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

It takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be deleted, and returns a Contact object that was just deleted.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • current_user – schemas.User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user))¶

The get_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of all the birthdays that are coming up in the next 30 days. The function takes two parameters: db and current_user. The db parameter is used to connect to the database, while the current_user parameter is used to get information about who’s currently logged in.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – schemas.User: Get the current user’s id

Returns:

A list of the upcoming birthdays for a user

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user))¶

The read_contact function is a helper function that will be used by the read_contact endpoint. It takes in an integer contact_id and returns the corresponding Contact object from the database. If no such contact exists, it raises a 404 error.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – schemas.User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object, which is a pydantic model

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user))¶

The read_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – schemas.User: Get the current user’s id

Returns:

A list of contacts (schemas

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.search_contacts(query: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user))¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

It takes a query string and returns all contacts that match the query. The search is case insensitive.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Specify the query string

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – schemas.User: Get the current user’s id

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user))¶

The update_contact function takes in a contact_id and a ContactUpdate object, and returns the updated contact. The function first checks if the user is authorized to update this contact, by checking if they are the owner of it. If not, an HTTPException is raised with status code 404 (Not Found). If so, then crud.update_contact() is called.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to update

  • contact – schemas.ContactUpdate: Pass the contact data to be updated

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – schemas.User: Get the current user

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.upload_avatar(file: UploadFile, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user))¶

The upload_avatar function uploads a user’s avatar to the cloudinary server. It takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded by the client. The function then uses Cloudinary’s Python SDK to upload the image and return its URL. Finally, it updates the current_user with their new avatar URL.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – schemas.User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

password: str¶

REST API repository Utils¶

utils.get_password_hash(password)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hashed version of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object from Flask-Bcrypt, which uses bcrypt to generate hashes.

Parameters:

password – Get the password from the user

Returns:

The hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

async utils.send_verification_email(email: str, token: str)¶

The send_verification_email function sends an email to the user with a link that they can click on to verify their email address. The function takes in two parameters:

-email: The user’s email address, which is used as the recipient of the verification message. -token: A token generated by FastAPI that will be sent along with the verification link so that we can verify it when it is clicked.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user who is going to receive an email

  • token – str: Pass the token to the send_verification_email function

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Trelent

utils.verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and a hashed password and verifies that the two match. It returns True if they do, False otherwise.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Store the hashed password in the database

Returns:

True if the password is correct, and false otherwise

Doc-author:

Trelent
